article_title: Ex-Im Bank Says China Lending to Hit New High
article_text:
SHANGHAI—The chairman of the embattled U.S. Export-Import Bank said Thursday that the trade credit institution will lend a record amount to buyers of U.S. goods in China this year, but faces more competition from Chinese credit agencies elsewhere around the world.

Fred P. Hochberg, the Ex-Im Bank's chairman and chief executive, said that U.S. exporters need increasing amounts of financial support to compete, both in China and in...
